page.title: 18WARNINGLID FETE -6th July'85
page.content: It was{opened}by Russell Pocket, a {D.J. from Radio Mercury, Crawley. The main attraction was the{hot air {balloon.}It was a huge balloon with a wicker basket attached to the bottom. Hot air is pumped into the balloon, which makes it rise. There were many{children's races.}One was the sack race, where you had to get into a sack and jump up to the finish in it.You got prizes for coming first, second or third. There were lots of{side shows}like a flower show tent,a grand draw,a children's maze,a balloon race,a welly throwing competition and a slippery pole. In the{middle of the field}there were{shows}like tug of war and a crate lifting competition.Sixteen of us from Warningid School did a{Country Dancing {Display}of 3 dances to music.
